New Post: Wordle today: Here‚Äôs the answer and hints for December 2 - https://lnkd.in/gv2w77Kr - Oh hey there! If you're here, it must be time for Wordle. As always, we're serving up our daily hints and tips to help you figure out today's answer.If you just want to be told today's word, you can jump to the bottom of this article for Dec. 2's Wordle solution revealed. But if you'd rather solve it yourself, keep reading for some clues, tips, and strategies to assist you.Where did Wordle come from?Originally created by engineer Josh Wardle as a gift for his partner, Wordle rapidly spread to become an international phenomenon, with thousands of people around the globe playing every day. Alternate Wordle versions created by fans also sprang up, including battle royale Squabble, music identification game Heardle, and variations like Dordle and Quordle that make you guess multiple words at once. Wordle eventually became so popular that it was purchased by the New York Times, and TikTok creators even livestream themselves playing.Not the day you're after? Here's the Wordle answer for Dec. 1.What's the best Wordle starting word?The best Wordle starting word is the one that speaks to you. But if you prefer to be strategic in your approach, we have a few ideas to help you pick a word that might help you find the solution faster. One tip is to select a word that includes at least two different vowels, plus some common consonants like S, T, R, or N. What happened to the Wordle archive?The entire archive of past Wordle puzzles used to be available for anyone to enjoy whenever they felt like it. Unfortunately, it has since been taken down, with the website's creator stating it was done at the request of the New York Times.Is Wordle getting harder?It might feel like Wordle is getting harder, but it actually isn't any more difficult than when it first began. You can turn on Wordle's Hard Mode if you're after more of a challenge, though.Why are there two different Wordle answers some days?Though usually Wordle will only accept one correct solution per day, occasionally it has rebelled against the norm and deem two different answers acceptable. This is due to changes the New York Times made to Wordle after it acquired the puzzle game.The Times has since added its own updated word list, so this should happen even less frequently than before. To avoid any confusion, it's a good idea to refresh your browser before getting stuck into a new puzzle.Here's a subtle hint for today's Wordle answer:A movie or TV category.Does today's Wordle answer have a double letter?There are letters that appear twice.Today's Wordle is a 5-letter word that starts with...Today's Wordle starts with the letter G. SEE ALSO: Wordle-obsessed? These are the best word games to play IRL. Do you remember a show called Total Request Live (TRL)? For those who don't, TRL was an American show on MTV in the late 90s that played the top ten most requested music videos of the day, as voted on by viewers via phone or online. The show also had near-daily segments from MTV News correspondents reporting on the latest in national or entertainment and music news from inside the studio. It became a cultural phenomenon. I remember coming home from school every day in time to put TRL on. Drawing some inspiration from that concept, we're excited to announce something new today that we're calling AudiencePlus Live (APL). APL is a monthly live broadcast for AudiencePlus subscribers where we deep dive into different elements of Owned Media execution - but instead of Carson Daly and Dave Holmes, you get me and Todd Clouser. But each month we'll break down one of the top requested questions from YOU on how to execute Owned Media well. And like TRL, our audience will be visible on the call providing feedback, ideas, and color commentary. We're starting with an important first topic. How to convert your audience into owned subscribers using exclusive content. There's a lot of momentum and belief behind Owned Media, but unless you're able to convert your unknown audience into known subscribers, you're doing the "media" bit but not the "owned" part. And as a result, you're missing out on all the benefits including lower cost of distribution, deeper insights into engagement, and an easier path to attribution of content on revenue. We'll walk through a tactical approach for developing an exclusive content strategy and answer your questions live. APL will be held on Wednesday, May 22nd at 10AM PST / 1PM EST. Shoot me a comment or DM below and I'll add you to the invite.
